comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: On the corner  of Gloucester and Cumberland Streets, where the Australian Hotel now is.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Three (?) years before, in 1898 - Sir William Johnson (1862-1932) "[The Whalers Arms, Gloucester Street, Sydney]" 1898 (NLA) - nla.gov.au/nla.pic-an2265550

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: Not quite on the corner of Gloucester and Cumberland Street, rather Gloucester and Cumberland Lane (formerly Cribbs Lane). The Australian Hotel is further back to the right of this photo. The Whalers Arms Hotel was across from Susannah Place, as can be seen here where the new YHA development on The Dig Site is. This is my favourite photo of The Whalers Arms, its so evocative. I seem to recall reading somewhere that it was operating as a lodging house in 1901. The more things change the more they stay the same!

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: As we all know there has never been a shortage of hotels in The Rocks!

comment.author: 29029178@N03
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Pubs of Australia, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: The 1901 NSW state election posters for Will Daley are popping up all over the place. See also: www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/4886221321/ www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/4886823514/ www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2633076600/ www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2632250969/ www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2801918748/ The election posters on the Whalers Arms are clearer on this picture: The Whalers Arms Hotel, corner of Gloucester Street and Cumberland Place, The Rocks (no date) [SRNSW: 4481_a026_000033]

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: Old Sydney (1902) by Hamilton G. Hammon [NLA: nla.pic-an5370975]

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: This photo was recently determined to be part of the Rocks Resumption photographic survey, the title and date of the image has been changed accordingly Here is a map of the Rocks Resumption area (last one in the sequence) AB
